title: "Data Import"
output: github_document
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

Let's import a dataset.

```{r}
litters_df = 
  read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")
```
Look at your data!!

```{r}
names(litters_df)
```


Update the names in 'litters_df'
Clean things up, remove spaces and replace with underscore, no @ symbols, etc
```{r}
litters_df = 
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```


Look at the data

```{r}
litters_df
```

Sometimes skimming data is neat?

```{r}
skimr::skim(litters_df)
```

## Fix the missingness

```{r}
litters_df = 
  read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv", na = c("NA", ".", ""))
```


## Import Pups data
remove the first 3 rows, variables row is not on top
clean variable names
```{r}
pups_df = 
  read_csv("data/FAS_pups.csv", 
           skip = 3, 
           na = c("NA", ".", ""))

pups_df = 
  janitor::clean_names(pups_df)

```
